title: Apple charlotte
description: This is an elegant version of a very rustic Charlotte that my mum makes. It is lighter than the classic recipe – much lower in butter – and it has a wonderful texture and very clean, clear flavours. You will notice that I have used two varieties of apple –  the Cox’s Orange Pippin has acidity and is wonderfully firm, while the Blenheim Orange begs to be puréed. The combination is what creates the magic. Bon appétit!
ingredients: 500g/1lb 2oz Cox’s Orange Pippin apples, peeled, cored and each cut into 8 wedges
250g/9oz Blenheim Orange apples (about 5), peeled and chopped
½ tsp vanilla purée or good-quality vanilla extract
200g/7oz wholemeal bread, cut into 11 slices; each 5mm/¼in thick
